text.p: Iatros Health Network Inc said Tuesday that its 1996 results were adversely affected by the writedown of assets totaling $12.4 million, but that it expected strong revenue grwoth in 1997.
The company, which had a net loss of $10.3 million in 1996, said that writedowns included $5.5 million for the for development fee collection reserves and $4.5 million for goodwill writedowns.

The company added that with these writedowns its balance sheet was now in "very good shape," and that it is "cautiously optimistic" that it will begin to show successive quarterly improvement in operating margins and strong revenue growth in 1997.

The first step in growing the company is 1997 was the addition of $10 million in annualized revenue with the leasing of two Massachusetts nursing homes, said the company, which it had announced two weeks ago.
Iatros, is a provider of management and health care ancillary services to the long-term care industry.
